intro: Jussiaea martii, commonly known as the swamp willow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub that typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along riverbanks. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in catkins and bloom in the spring. Jussiaea martii plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic and terrestrial wildlife.
